title: Pedro Manuel de Almeida Carvalho Vieira | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Pedro Vieira nasceu em Lisboa, Portugal, em 1974. Obteve o grau de licenciado, mestre e doutor em Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores no Instituto Superior Técnico (IST), Universidade de Lisboa (UL) em 1997, 2003 e 2008, respetivamente. Recentemente, ele concluiu o seu Mestrado Executivo em Administração de Empresas (MBA) no ISCTE Executive Education na edição de 2022/2024.
h2: Pedro Manuel de Almeida Carvalho Vieira
text:
Pedro Manuel de Almeida Carvalho Vieira
Email:
pedro.vieira@isel.pt
Gabinete:
F.0.11
Pedro Vieira
nasceu em Lisboa, Portugal, em 1974. Obteve o grau de licenciado, mestre e doutor em Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores no Instituto Superior Técnico (IST), Universidade de Lisboa (UL) em 1997, 2003 e 2008, respetivamente. Recentemente, ele concluiu o seu Mestrado Executivo em Administração de Empresas (MBA) no ISCTE Executive Education na edição de 2022/2024.
Desde 1997, encontra-se no ISEL, mais concretamente no DEETC. No presente, é Professor Coordenador com Agregação, Coordenador de Curso da Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Redes e Telecomunicações (LEIRT) e é responsável pelas unidades curriculares de Rádio-Comunicações, Comunicações Móveis e Planeamento e Otimização de Redes Móveis, pertencentes à Licenciatura em Engenharia Eletrónica e Telecomunicações e de Computadores (LEETC), LEIRT e Mestrado em Engenharia Eletrónica e Telecomunicações (MEET). Em paralelo, já orientou e coorientou mais de 90 projetos finais de ciclo de estudos entre licenciatura, mestrado e doutoramento, bem como realizou diversas tarefas de gestão académica.
É também engenheiro sénior pela Ordem dos Engenheiros (OE), tendo sido outorgado com o título de especialista em telecomunicações pela OE, em 2008.
Em 2016, obteve o título de especialista em telecomunicações pelo Instituto Politécnico de Lisboa (IPL).
No Instituto de Telecomunicações (IT), investiga assuntos relacionados com as comunicações sem fios, incluindo propagação via rádio e por luz visível, planeamento e otimização de redes móveis e Redes Auto-Organizáveis (Self-Organizing Networks, SON), sendo autor e co-autor de mais de 200 artigos publicados em revistas e atas de conferências internacionais e nacionais da especialidade. Da lista de publicações salientam-se as colaborações com docentes e alunos do IST, no domínio das comunicações via rádio e do ISEL e CTS/UNINOVA no domínio das comunicações por luz visível (Visible Light Communications, VLC), mais concretamente em sistemas geo-posicionados indoor e ainda em comunicações veiculares.
No presente, continua a coordenar e a realizar investigação aplicada, sendo investigador responsável pelo IT e ISEL em diversos projetos de Investigação & Desenvolvimento (I&D), a nível nacional e internacional, e executados em parceria com universidades, institutos politécnicos, centros de investigação e com empresas de cariz tecnológico.
Adicionalmente, e dentro do contexto da colaboração com empresas, coordena um grupo de investigação sediado na empresa CELFINET, ao abrigo de um protocolo de colaboração celebrado com o ISEL, onde explora a realização de investigação científica aplicada como base para o desenvolvimento de novos conceitos, ferramentas e algoritmos nas áreas das Tecnologias das Redes Móveis (2G, 3G, 4G e 5G) e Redes Auto-organizáveis (Self-Organizing Networks, SON).

title: Pedro Manuel Fernandes Carvalho da Silva | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Pedro Fernandes Silva é Professor no Departamento de Física do Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa (ISEL) e Professor Convidado do Departamento de Engenharia Geográfica, Geofísica e Energia da faculdade de Ciências da Universidade de Lisboa (FCUL). É doutorado em Física – Ciências Geofísicas, pela Universidade de Lisboa. É atualmente Vice-Presidente do ISEL, investigador sénior do Laboratório Associado - Instituto Dom Luiz (IDL) e membro da Comissão Executiva do Colaboratório para as Geociências (C4G).
h2: Pedro Manuel Fernandes Carvalho da Silva
text:
Pedro Manuel Fernandes Carvalho da Silva
Email:
pedro.fsilva@isel.pt
Pedro Fernandes Silva é Professor no Departamento de Física do Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa (ISEL) e Professor Convidado do Departamento de Engenharia Geográfica, Geofísica e Energia da faculdade de Ciências da Universidade de Lisboa (FCUL). É doutorado em Física – Ciências Geofísicas, pela Universidade de Lisboa.
É atualmente Vice-Presidente do ISEL, investigador sénior do Laboratório Associado - Instituto Dom Luiz (IDL) e membro da Comissão Executiva do Colaboratório para as Geociências (C4G).
A sua investigação recai essencialmente na caracterização de várias propriedade físicas de minerais ferromagnéticos e sua aplicação a processos geofísicos/geológicos, tais como, magnetismo ambiental, variação secular do campo magnético terrestre, tectónica de placas avaliada por paleomagnetismo e geomagnetismo, processos ígneos intrusivos, depósitos sedimentares associados a transporte de massa de alta energia, e riscos naturais associados a tsunamis e instabilidade de ilhas vulcânicas.

title: Pedro Miguel Martins Ferreira | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Pedro Ferreira licenciou-se em Física na Faculdade de Ciências da Universidade de Lisboa (FCUL), em 1992, e tirou o mestrado, em Altas Energias e Gravitação, na mesma instituição, concluindo-o em 1995. Fez o doutoramento em física de partículas teórica na Universidade de Liverpool entre 1995 e 1998, tendo de seguida feito três pós-docs, no INFN de Génova (1998-2000), DIAS em Dublin (2000-2001) e no Centro de Física Teórica e Computacional da FCUL (2001 a 2007).

title: Pedro Miguel Soares Raposeiro da Silva | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Pedro Raposeiro da Silva is an Associate Professor (Professor Coordenador) of construction materials and construction technology at Lisbon School of Engineering, Polytechnic University of Lisbon, and a researcher member of CERIS – Civil Engineering Research and Innovation for Sustainability (research group of studies on construction) from Instituto Superior Técnico, UL - University of Lisbon.
h2: Pedro Miguel Soares Raposeiro da Silva
text:
Pedro Miguel Soares Raposeiro da Silva
Email:
pedro.msilva@isel.pt
Pedro Raposeiro da Silva is an Associate Professor (Professor Coordenador) of construction materials and construction technology at Lisbon School of Engineering, Polytechnic University of Lisbon, and a researcher member of CERIS – Civil Engineering Research and Innovation for Sustainability (research group of studies on construction) from Instituto Superior Técnico, UL - University of Lisbon.
He received his PhD in Civil Engineering and his master’s in construction from Instituto Superior Técnico, UL - University of Lisbon and has a bachelor’s degree in civil engineering from Lisbon School of Engineering, Polytechnic University of Lisbon.
His research interests include self-compacting concrete, concrete microstructure and durability, sustainable construction (recycled aggregates in concrete and mortars) and construction technology. Author and reviewer of numerous publications in his area of interest, is currently the Civil Engineering Master Program Coordinator and responsible for the Construction Materials Laboratory at Lisbon School of Engineering, Polytechnic University of Lisbon.

É Professor Associado Convidado do Departamento de Física do Instituto Superior Técnico desde 2011 e investigador e membro permanente do Centro de Física Teórica de Partículas desde 2004.

title: Rui Manuel Feliciano de Jesus | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Rui Jesus é professor coordenador no Departamento de Engenharia Informática do ISEL/IPL onde leciona temas nas áreas de produção de conteúdos multimédia, interação pessoa-máquina e computação móvel. É também coordenador do mestrado em Engenharia Informática e Multimédia.
text:
Rui Manuel Feliciano de Jesus
Email:
rui.jesus@isel.pt
Gabinete:
F.0.13
Rui Jesus é professor coordenador no Departamento de Engenharia Informática do ISEL/IPL onde leciona temas nas áreas de produção de conteúdos multimédia, interação pessoa-máquina e computação móvel. É também coordenador do mestrado em Engenharia Informática e Multimédia.
É membro do centro de investigação, NOVA LINCS, Faculdade de Ciências e Tecnologia da Universidade NOVA de Lisboa (grupo de Sistemas Multimodais) onde realiza atividades de investigação nas áreas de processamento de informação multimédia e interação multimodal. Os principais temas de investigação são a sumarização de imagens e vídeos em memórias pessoais e coletivas e a exploração de interfaces naturais para entretenimento, património cultural e comunicação de riscos de desastres naturais.
Esteve envolvido em diversos projetos de pesquisa com outros centros de investigação e com empresas, como LeucoDiff, DigiT FUP, VideoFlow, InStory, Crossing Borders e Crush. É autor e coautor de várias publicações em jornais e conferências com revisão por pares.

title: Rui Manuel Gouveia Filipe | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa

text:
Rui Manuel Gouveia Filipe
Email:
rui.filipe@isel.pt
Rui Manuel Gouveia Filipe obteve o Doutoramento em Engenharia Química em 2009 pelo Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade Técnica de Lisboa, o Mestrado em Engenharia Sanitária em 1999 pela Faculdade de Ciências e Tecnologia, Universidade Nova de Lisboa e a Licenciatura em Engenharia Química em 1993 pelo Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa.
É Professor Adjunto do Departamento de Engenharia Química do Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa e membro integrado do CERENA – Centro de Recursos Naturais e Ambiente.
É autor e coautor de 27 publicações em revistas e capítulos de livros e colaborou com 37 co-autores. Participou como investigador em 5 projetos de investigação e recebeu 2 prémios pelas suas contribuições.
O seu trabalho abrange áreas como a modelação, simulação e otimização aplicadas a biorrefinarias sustentáveis, captura de CO2, armazenamento termoquímico de energia e sistemas de destilação reativa.

Sérgio Jorge Pereira da Costa, está no Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa (ISEL) do Instituto Politécnico de Lisboa (IPL) desde 1997, sendo actualmente Professor Adjunto do Departamento de Engenharia Química.
Obteve o Doutoramento em Engenharia Química e Bioquímica (Ph.D.) em 2016 na Faculdade de Ciências e Tecnologia da Universidade Nova de Lisboa (FCT-UNL), Portugal, com o trabalho intitulado: “Multi-Agent Model Predictive Control for Transport Phenomena Processes”. Obteve, ainda, o grau de Mestre em Engenharia Química (M.Sc.) em 2008, na área de Controlo de Sistemas e Processos Químicos, a Licenciatura em Engenharia Química – Ramo Indústria em 2004 e o Bacharelato em Engenharia Química (B.Sc.) em 1996, todos eles pelo ISEL.
Tem como principais áreas de interesse, investigação e publicação em Controlo de Processos, nomeadamente nas áreas de Controlo Predictivo/Adaptativo, Sistemas Não Lineares de dimensão Infinita e Sistemas de Parâmetros Distribuídos, tendo mais de uma dezena de publicações em revistas internacionais, capítulos de livros e artigos em conferências internacionais e nacionais.

text:
Vitor Manuel Barbas de Oliveira
Email:

Vitor Oliveira licenciou-se em Física Tecnológica pela Faculdade de Ciências da Universidade de Lisboa em 1996, e doutorou-se em Engenharia de Materiais pelo Instituto Superior Técnico (IST) em 2002. É também mestre em Ciência e Engenharia de Superfícies pela Faculdade de Ciências e Tecnologia da Universidade Nova de Lisboa (1998).
É professor adjunto no ISEL desde 2008, no Departamento de Física, onde leciona unidades curriculares do grupo disciplinar de Física da Licenciatura em Engenharia Mecânica e desenvolve trabalho científico na área do ensino da Física. Anteriormente foi monitor no IST (2001/2001), professor adjunto no Instituto Politécnico da Guarda (2001/2003), professor auxiliar na Escola de Ciências da Universidade do Minho (2003/2004), e pós-doutorando no IST (2005/2008).
Além da sua atividade no ISEL, é membro do Centro de Física e Engenharia de Materiais Avançados do IST, onde desenvolve investigação na área do tratamento de materiais avançados com lasers ultra-rápidos. É autor e coautor de mais de 70 publicações científicas e pedagógicas.

Os seus interesses actuais estão nas áreas dos sistemas embebidos e IoT (CPS).

title: Vítor Manuel Rodrigues Anes | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Vitor Anes nasceu em Lisboa, Portugal, em 1976, e obteve os graus de mestre e de doutor em engenharia mecânica, em 2009 e 2015, respetivamente, ambos pelo Instituto Superior Técnico da Universidade de Lisboa. Em 2020 obtém o doutoramento em engenharia de concepção e produção - líderes em indústrias tecnológicas, também pelo Instituto Superior Técnico em parceria com o Massachussets Institute of Technology (MIT).
text:
Vítor Manuel Rodrigues Anes
Email:
vitor.anes@isel.pt
Vitor Anes nasceu em Lisboa, Portugal, em 1976, e obteve os graus de mestre e de doutor em engenharia mecânica, em 2009 e 2015, respetivamente, ambos pelo Instituto Superior Técnico da Universidade de Lisboa. Em 2020 obtém o doutoramento em engenharia de concepção e produção - líderes em indústrias tecnológicas, também pelo Instituto Superior Técnico em parceria com o Massachussets Institute of Technology (MIT). É docente do Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa (ISEL) no Departamento de Engenharia Mecânica desde 2015, onde leciona unidades curriculares da licenciatura e do mestrado em engenharia mecânica assim como do mestrado em engenharia e gestão industrial.
Vitor Anes tem vindo a realizar atividades de investigação em diversas áreas tais como o desenvolvimento de novos produtos, projeto mecânico, caracterização mecânica de materiais, integridade estrutural, seleção de materiais, fiabilidade, avaliação e gestão do risco em inovação, tomada de decisão multicritério, e simulação de processos e operações. Tem sido colaborador em vários projetos de investigação e conta com mais de 70 artigos publicados em jornais científicos e atas de conferências científicas internacionais. Mais recentemente, Vitor Anes tem-se concentrado no desenvolvimento de modelos de avaliação e gestão do risco de sistemas complexos usando abordagens qualitativas e quantitativas.  As aplicações deste trabalho visam dar suporte às tomadas de decisão no contexto do desenvolvimento e implementação de projetos de inovação.

title: Computer Science and Engineering | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: The Department of Computer Science and Engineering (DEI) creates and transmits knowledge in line with the state of the art in the field of computer engineering — essential knowledge for the development of an increasingly digital society.
text:
The Department of Computer Science and Engineering (DEI) creates and transmits knowledge in line with the state of the art in the field of computer engineering — essential knowledge for the development of an increasingly digital society.
DEI offers four engineering degree programs: two at the bachelor's level and two at the master's level. These programs reflect innovation and pedagogical advancement achieved through the active involvement of faculty in teaching, research, and innovation activities, as well as through participation in projects carried out in collaboration with companies and other public and private entities, both national and international.
The excellence of the thousands of professionals trained in DEI programs is widely recognized in both the business and scientific communities, as demonstrated by an employability rate of nearly 100% and the prominent positions they hold in national and multinational companies.
Courses
Computer Science and Computer Engineering BSc
Informatics and Multimedia Engineering BSc
Computer Science and Computer Engineering MSc
Informatics and Multimedia Engineering MSc

title: Music | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
text:
With the common purpose of spreading and promoting academic music, the Lisbon School of Engineering (ISEL) has a female and a male academic band – so tradition dictates. They rehearse and do shows all over the country and still find time for a lot of partying (yes, some studying as well). No matter if your preference goes to classical or folk instruments, singing or leading the band, here you’ll find both fun and support as nowhere else. Reach us by email (

title: Applied Physical Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: If you are looking to learn how to develop creative and innovative engineering solutions to meet current societal and environmental needs, and anticipate those of the future, then the 1st cycle study programme in Applied Physical Engineering (LEFA) is the right choice for you.
text:
If you are looking to learn how to develop creative and innovative engineering solutions to meet current societal and environmental needs, and anticipate those of the future, then the 1st cycle study programme in Applied Physical Engineering (LEFA) is the right choice for you.
A substantial amount of teaching and learning takes place in a "workshop" environment, so the knowledge you acquire will be strongly lab-based. Instrumentation and electronics, data acquisition, robotics, digital communications and 3D printing are just some of the skills that will propel you to the forefront of technological progress and enable you to benefit from the novel realities and opportunities afforded by electronic prototyping platforms and the IoT (Internet of Things) revolution.
In addition to a sound instruction in mathematics, physics and engineering sciences, you will also undertake a final-year work placement/internship with a company or some other institution. You will be well-qualified to either join the workforce straight after graduation or proceed to further study.. Career options as diverse as R&D labs and research centres, teaching, industry, technology and finance, regulators and accreditation agencies will all be awaiting you.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Biomedical Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Without Chemical and Biological Engineering, we would live in a world without medicines, vaccines, textiles, fuels, rubber, plastic, detergents or pesticides – that is, we would live without much of what is around us and sustains our way of life.
text:
Without Chemical and Biological Engineering, we would live in a world without medicines, vaccines, textiles, fuels, rubber, plastic, detergents or pesticides – that is, we would live without much of what is around us and sustains our way of life.
Today we live surrounded by and dependent on products and materials generated by the chemical and biotechnological industries, and we are increasingly aware of how important it is that these industries adapt to the urgency of a more sustainable existence. The challenge in Chemical and Biological Engineering is to reconcile good performance of products and materials with protecting the environment, natural resources and the balance of all the variables in this complex equation.
This is the challenge we will prepare you for. We offer you a recently modernized program, with the practical teaching that has always characterized us, the opportunity to participate in research projects, and a close relationship between students and teachers. Our agenda: to train the professionals who stand at the vanguard of one of the most significant challenges of our planet.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Chemical and Biological Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: This course trains professionals able to act effectively in companies linked to Biological and Chemical industries and related industries and service companies.The course of study aims to assign a solid background to pursue the professional activity but also allowing lifelong learning.The training over the course aims to:
text:
This course trains professionals able to act effectively in companies linked to Biological and Chemical industries and related industries and service companies.The course of study aims to assign a solid background to pursue the professional activity but also allowing lifelong learning.The training over the course aims to:
Give a solid background in mathematics, physics, chemistry, biotechnology and environment.
Give a solid background in management and quality.
Give a comprehensive and profound understanding of the main concepts of Engineering.
Enhance the ability of each student to adapt to changes.
Develop skills of critical and independent school work.
Provide experience in professional engineering aspects.
Provide practical experience through laboratory work involving the execution of experiments and problem solving methodologies.
Integrate knowledge learned in conducting a final project work.
High employability of graduates.
Interaction with the community, translated into protocols with external entities (companies, industry associations, order of the engineers, agencies, institutions of superior education and scientific societies).
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Civil Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Civil Engineering has been around for a long time, but that has not made it any less dynamic today: it would be impossible for us to conceive our way of life without buildings and compounds to live, work and rest in, without roads, bridges and railways; without airports, ports and dams. We increasingly want to achieve all of the above in a more pleasant, integrated, efficient and sustainable way. We want to build, recycle and rehabilitate. We want the past and the present to guarantee the future.
text:
Civil Engineering has been around for a long time, but that has not made it any less dynamic today: it would be impossible for us to conceive our way of life without buildings and compounds to live, work and rest in, without roads, bridges and railways; without airports, ports and dams.
We increasingly want to achieve all of the above in a more pleasant, integrated, efficient and sustainable way. We want to build, recycle and rehabilitate. We want the past and the present to guarantee the future.
On the bachelor’s degree course in Civil Engineering, our teaching experience and strong connection to society, industry and R&D result in training where the practical component is king.
Currently in growing demand, the bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering meets the needs and demands of study and project firms, city councils, construction and consulting companies, inspection, management and maintenance companies – and, why not, your own company!
Good balance between the theoretical and practical aspects. The skills obtained by students are of interest to potential employers.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Computer Science and Computer Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Mobile phone applications, web applications, operating systems and much more – all in just one course! In the banking and services sector, in consulting companies, in healthcare institutions, as well as in software development companies, administration and maintenance of computer or information systems, the demand for computer engineers is permanently on the rise. However, in order to be successful in a constantly evolving world, one needs to have the knowledge, the know-how, and the ability to put them into dialogue.
h2: Computer Science and Computer Engineering BSc
text:
Mobile phone applications, web applications, operating systems and much more – all in just one course!
In the banking and services sector, in consulting companies, in healthcare institutions, as well as in software development companies, administration and maintenance of computer or information systems, the demand for computer engineers is permanently on the rise. However, in order to be successful in a constantly evolving world, one needs to have the knowledge, the know-how, and the ability to put them into dialogue.
Our bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and Computer Engineering is the product of extensive experience and direct cooperation with services, companies and industry, both public and private, allied to intense R&D activity, which makes it the answer to those who want to stay up to date with what is state of the art and acquire all the tools to go further.
With employability more than guaranteed, we have not always been able to convince our students to graduate before starting work...
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Electrical Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Without energy, there is no life - eco-friendly energy, preferably!
text:
Without energy, there is no life - eco-friendly energy, preferably!
It would be impossible to list all the applications of electric power, but it is trivial to see that a huge part of our existence depends on it. From the mobile phone, the tablet or the computer that you are using to read these lines, and which you use for so many different things, to all the other electrical devices that surround you, the robots that build them or bring all kinds of products to us, or the ever increasing range of transport that use electric energy... nothing in our life would be the same without energy, which is why it is so important to use it in a sustainable way.
In our bachelor’s degree in Electric Engineering, technological developments come to higher education to prepare our students for a constantly growing world – be it in the area of electrical plants, renewable energy, instrumentation, automation or control.
In an area that the European Union has identified as a priority in higher education training, your only difficulty after completing this degree will be what to choose to work on next.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Electronics, Telecommunications and Computer Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: To be alive is to be on! Nowadays, it is impossible to function without a smartphone, a tablet or a computer that synchronizes us with the world. Electronic devices are an integral part of our way of life and we rely on them for a multitude of tasks.
h2: Electronics, Telecommunications and Computer Engineering  BSc
text:
To be alive is to be on! Nowadays, it is impossible to function without a smartphone, a tablet or a computer that synchronizes us with the world. Electronic devices are an integral part of our way of life and we rely on them for a multitude of tasks.
The only surprise is that new devices and uses, better systems, and more useful applications keep coming onto the market. A graduate in Electronics, Telecommunications and Computer Engineering is at the very intersection where all of this comes into being. Thanks to a training program that features the most advanced labs, lecturers who are at the forefront of the development of important innovations, and a unique academic spirit, this is where engineers able to tackle the current challenges of a sector that continues to revolutionize life on the planet are born.
With zero employability issues on the horizon, the choice between entering the labour market and going on to a postgraduate degree is entirely up to you – at the speed of a click!
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Informatics and Multimedia Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa

This is core where the way we deal with the devices on which our daily life depends is build.
Our bachelor’s degree in Computer and Multimedia Engineering is constantly being updated – it could not be otherwise. Here, you learn to develop multimedia applications for the internet and for mobile devices, interactive multimedia (real or virtual) environments, 3D animation, games, smart systems, interface technologies between the physical and digital world, the production of audio, image and video content – and much more! And all of this is constantly evolving, bringing you new tools to experiment with and new developments to explore.
Our course emphasizes practical learning and a close relationship between students and teachers. It allows you to choose your pathway according to your main interests and it prepares you to be a highly qualified professional in an area that is crucial in sectors such as communications, education, entertainment, industry, medicine and scientific research. Which will you choose?
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Informatics, Networks and Telecommunications Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: These are the engineers of the future! Our bachelor’s degree in Informatics, Networks and Telecommunications Engineering is the meeting point for computer science and telecommunication networks, be them fix or mobile – this is where the development of cloud computational systems, online applications, cellular networks, data networks, or the Internet Of Things take place. Without the sophisticated sharing of information and interconnection between systems that the area of Networks and Telecommunications ensures, nothing would work as intended.
h2: Informatics, Networks and Telecommunications Engineering BSc
text:
These are the engineers of the future!
Our bachelor’s degree in Informatics, Networks and Telecommunications Engineering is the meeting point for computer science and telecommunication networks, be them fix or mobile – this is where the development of cloud computational systems, online applications, cellular networks, data networks, or the Internet Of Things take place. Without the sophisticated sharing of information and interconnection between systems that the area of Networks and Telecommunications ensures, nothing would work as intended.
Through a learning approach with a strong practical component and a faculty that combines teaching with continuing participation in industry and services projects, we guarantee the applicability of the up-to-date knowledge acquired by our students. Your unique professional skills mean that you will have no employability problems. You will also be able to easily go on to a postgraduate degree, should that be your choice.
So, if you are interested in computer sciences applied to networks and telecommunications, your future is here.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Mathematics Applied to Technology and Enterprise BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: If you like Mathematics and picture yourself tackling real problems, devising strategies, finding solutions... you have come to the right place!
h2: Mathematics Applied to Technology and Enterprise BSc
text:
If you like Mathematics and picture yourself tackling real problems, devising strategies, finding solutions... you have come to the right place!
Our course has been developed inside out. You will not finish if wondering what it will be like in the real world, because ISEL’s bachelor’s in Mathematics Applied to Technology and Business was designed in collaboration with numerous leading companies and organizations from diverse sectors of the economy. The training we provide to our students is thus automatically tuned with the needs of the labour market. As if that was not enough, your final semester will be an internship at one of our partner organizations – Lisbon City Council, Delta, GALP, LNEC, Infrastructures of Portugal, REN, Iberomoldes, Celfinet, Closer, among many others – and so the issue of your first professional experience is already taken care of.
With skills in data science, modelling, simulation and programming, and bringing together mathematical training and knowledge in engineering and management, the notion that your course and the outside world have nothing to do with each other is definitely a thing of the past.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Mechanical Engineering BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: No engineering field is more complete than Mechanical Engineering! Whether in one of the various branches of automation and control, in one of the multiple activities in the automobile, aeronautics or aerospace industry, in the energy, construction, healthcare or nanotechnology sectors, the need and demand for mechanical engineers never slows down.
text:
No engineering field is more complete than Mechanical Engineering!
Whether in one of the various branches of automation and control, in one of the multiple activities in the automobile, aeronautics or aerospace industry, in the energy, construction, healthcare or nanotechnology sectors, the need and demand for mechanical engineers never slows down.
At ISEL, the bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering trains you to be a highly prepared professional for the current challenges and for the permanent evolution in equipment, systems and processes. Our curricular structure, faculty, lab resources, the opportunity to participate in special projects, along with our academic environment, will grant you the best possible experience.
In a world without borders, the wide-reaching and cross-national nature of Mechanical Engineering grants you the ability to go and succeed anywhere.
If Mechanical Engineering is what you are looking for, ISEL is the place for you!
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Municipal Technologies and Management BSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Big cities may have their shortcomings, but they can also have many assets in their favour. Here, you will learn to do more for life in urban centers – home to half of the world's population.
text:
Big cities may have their shortcomings, but they can also have many assets in their favour. Here, you will learn to do more for life in urban centers – home to half of the world's population.
Knowing how to find a place for everyone - children, young people, adults and the elderly; pedestrians and public and personal transport; nature and buildings - and for everything - housing, education, health, commerce, services, heritage, green spaces, culture, leisure; competitiveness and sustainability – poses challenges as huge as they are interesting, important, and pressing. Knowing how to plan, execute, maintain and supervise this precious balance is the task of Municipal Management.
After graduating, there will be no red traffic lights on your way to a city or parish council, to a central or regional administration department, or to a consulting firm. With training in the areas of the environment, urbanism, transport, waste and sanitation you will get an integrated perspective of what a city is, and you will be able to contribute to your well-being and that of everyone.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Applied Mathematics for Industry MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: ISEL’s master’s in Mathematics Applied to Industry is our recently launched master's course in an area of specialization with growing demand in the business/industry world. Our goal is to train students with the mathematical and computational skills that will enable them to expertly solve multidisciplinary problems in industry sectors – technology, logistics, consulting, banking, insurance, or R&D.
text:
ISEL’s master’s in Mathematics Applied to Industry is our recently launched master's course in an area of specialization with growing demand in the business/industry world. Our goal is to train students with the mathematical and computational skills that will enable them to expertly solve multidisciplinary problems in industry sectors – technology, logistics, consulting, banking, insurance, or R&D.
Our masters in Mathematics Applied to Industry (MMAI) develops solid skills in analytical, numerical and statistical methods – the basis of applied mathematics – and sound training in modelling, programming and simulation, which make it possible to apply mathematics to a wide variety of practical problems.
The MMAI provides students with the opportunity to build their own training profile, combining a common curriculum with various optional units (including, but not limited to, dynamic systems, image processing, machine learning, data mining, programming, computer security, and artificial intelligence). In their last semester of the course, students can choose to dedicate themselves to one of the following: a dissertation, a project, or an internship. In line with several other ISEL courses, the MMAI was designed and will be carried out in collaboration with several prominent and well-respected business and industrial entities.
Experts in the ability to capture the essentials of real situations and in finding solutions to the problems before them through the identification of appropriate mathematical models, the holders of our MMAI will be the bridges between mathematics and the real world.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Biomedical Engineering MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: ISEL’s masters in Biomedical Engineering is a multidisciplinary, contemporary and innovative training program in the interface between Engineering and Medicine. Our master’s is taught jointly by ISEL and the Lisbon School of Health Technology – a partnership that results in a truly interdisciplinary and comprehensive course, taught by a wide range of experts in its various areas of intervention. Our course is intended for both engineering and health sciences graduates, and its basic training is adjusted to the student's background. Optional course units such as
text:
ISEL’s masters in Biomedical Engineering is a multidisciplinary, contemporary and innovative training program in the interface between Engineering and Medicine. Our master’s is taught jointly by ISEL and the Lisbon School of Health Technology – a partnership that results in a truly interdisciplinary and comprehensive course, taught by a wide range of experts in its various areas of intervention.
Our course is intended for both engineering and health sciences graduates, and its basic training is adjusted to the student's background. Optional course units such as
Medical Equipment and Image Processing
Biomechanics, Orthoprosthesis and Artificial Organs
Molecular Diagnosis and Regenerative Medicine
Hospital Information and Equipment Management
enable each student to meet their desired professional profile and development.
This is an area of growing demand that knows no boundaries. Our graduates face no obstacles when entering the labour market – pharmaceutical, medical, and biotechnology industries; healthcare R&D institutes and centers; companies that supply diagnostic, therapeutics, rehabilitation, or life support equipment; hospital management consulting; government agencies; accreditation and certification bodies –, where they distinguish themselves as multidisciplinary professionals, ready to have a direct impact on people’s quality of life.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Chemical and Biological Engineering MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: ISEL’s master's degree in Chemical and Biological Engineering provides a solid scientific training in chemical and biological engineering. Our postgraduate students develop the skills that enable them to apply their knowledge to new situations, with a full understanding of the phenomena involved and the ability to design and/or simulate the behaviour of chemical, biological or related processes.
text:
ISEL’s master's degree in Chemical and Biological Engineering provides a solid scientific training in chemical and biological engineering. Our postgraduate students develop the skills that enable them to apply their knowledge to new situations, with a full understanding of the phenomena involved and the ability to design and/or simulate the behaviour of chemical, biological or related processes. Our course focuses heavily on the design, development, optimization and management of processes, and the training provided is complemented by a lab component, common to the various scientific areas that make up the syllabus. It also places special emphasis on promoting entrepreneurship and innovation.
Our postgraduate students earn solid skills that they will go on to apply in the areas of basic chemistry, fermentation, pharmaceutical and specialty chemistry, petroleum refining and petrochemistry and the transformation of lignocellulosic and food materials. Our masters in Chemical and Biological Engineering comprises two branches – “Biochemical Processes” and “Bioprocesses” – and provides our students with in-depth specialization. Our training program is also distinct in its synchrony with the real needs of the labour market, its keenness to solve industrial problems and develop novel solutions, and in fostering entrepreneurship, leadership, teamwork and collaboration, and communication skills.
Holders of our master’s degree can perform at the highest professional level in activities that include executing chemical and biological projects; providing services to the industry sector; the control and optimization of processes; processes simulation; products and processes development; and research/teaching.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Civil Engineering MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: The Master's Degree in Civil Engineering provides graduates in Civil Engineering with the opportunity to develop the knowledge acquired in the 1st cycle of studies, providing them with the skills to build a foundation for original applications in the field of research, understand and solve problems in new situations and in broad, multidisciplinary contexts, and intervene in the various stages of design, supervision and construction management, in the various associated areas (planning, coordination, materials, construction solutions and technologies, human and material resources management,
text:
The Master's Degree in Civil Engineering provides graduates in Civil Engineering with the opportunity to develop the knowledge acquired in the 1st cycle of studies, providing them with the skills to build a foundation for original applications in the field of research, understand and solve problems in new situations and in broad, multidisciplinary contexts, and intervene in the various stages of design, supervision and construction management, in the various associated areas (planning, coordination, materials, construction solutions and technologies, human and material resources management, etc.).
The Master's Degree is based on a common core, distributed throughout the 1st year of the course, plus one curricular unit in the 2nd year, subdivided into 2 branches in the 2nd year (3rd semester): “
Structures and Construction
”; “
Planning, Design and Construction of Infrastructures
”; The specific training involves completing 3 courses specific to each of the branches and 2 optional courses that students can select from a range of courses in the areas of
Construction
Structures
Communications
Transport
Hydraulics
Managemen
t or
Geotechnics
At the end of the course, students are able to use essential tools in the field of economics, quality and management, to communicate reasoning and conclusions to both specialists and non-specialists, and to continue learning throughout their lives. Our graduates are prepared to take advantage of the opportunities in a sector with high employability and perform high-level functions in various activities, such as construction and public works companies, construction materials industries, prefabrication industries, design and development offices, municipal management bodies, consultancy, inspection, management and maintenance companies for projects, and teaching and/or research institutions.

title: Electrical Engineering MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: ISEL’s master course in Electric Engineering (MEE) provides postgraduate students with professional skills and acceptance in the global labour market. Students can choose to specialize in Energy or in Automation and Industrial Electronics.
text:
ISEL’s master course in Electric Engineering (MEE) provides postgraduate students with professional skills and acceptance in the global labour market. Students can choose to specialize in Energy or in Automation and Industrial Electronics. They will master advanced-level syllabus content in a wide variety of important topics: production and transmission of electric power; power grid and electrical installation design; electric machinery design; nuclear power and renewable energy; control systems; smart systems; drive, protection and control of power semiconductors; electromechanical drives; automation and supervision networks; robotic systems; and management and economics in energy markets.
Our faculty includes doctorates/researchers and specialists with recognized professional experience. They endow our course the applied character that enables our postgraduate students to experience an easy adaptation to the job market and to perform expertly in their profession.
Electric power production; transport or distribution companies; industrial units with a strong automation and electromechanical component; industrial automation and technical building automation facilities; industrial, commercial, residential, hospital and hotel units or parks; technical departments at local, regional or central government bodies, as well as at certification agencies; mining companies, refineries, port facilities, airports and railway companies; water supply companies; applied research in science and technology institutions; metrology; instrumentation; testing equipment and testing facilities – these are just some of the many opportunities in an industry of remarkable employability. An opportunity not to be missed!
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Electronics and Telecommunications Engineering MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: At ISEL, the masters in Electronics and Telecommunications Engineering ensures advanced, comprehensive and current training in telecommunications and electronics.
text:
At ISEL, the masters in Electronics and Telecommunications Engineering ensures advanced, comprehensive and current training in telecommunications and electronics.
This postgraduate course provides an in-depth approach to the technological and design aspects of all the unavoidable topics in this are: new generation fixed and mobile telecommunications networks; optical communications and technologies; biomedical instrumentation and programmable and integrated electronic systems. Our graduates acquire sound analytical abilities and practical skills in design and implementation of telecommunications and /or electronic systems. The strong applied component, ensured through practical coursework and lab activities supervised and encouraged by a faculty deeply involved in development and technological research projects and consultancy, as well as in advanced training in national and international cooperation projects, guarantees our postgraduate students an easy adaptation to the reality of the labour market. Special attention is also devoted to the development of autonomous learning and innovation skills, which ensure the student's ability to continually adapt to changes in the state of the art in an ever-evolving sector.
The ‘major and minor’ structure of this master’s – telecommunications / electronics, according to the student's interests – results in a highly qualified training in the areas of the electronics, telecommunications, and computers, able to respond to complex challenges in engineering and reengineering.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Industrial Engineering and Management MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: ISEL’s masters course in Industrial Engineering and Management is a multi-purpose program that provides students with an integrated vision of production and services systems management. This course responds to the labour market’s growing demand for engineering professionals with a set of broadband skills that make them as comfortable with the technical as with the business aspects of their field.
text:
ISEL’s masters course in Industrial Engineering and Management is a multi-purpose program that provides students with an integrated vision of production and services systems management. This course responds to the labour market’s growing demand for engineering professionals with a set of broadband skills that make them as comfortable with the technical as with the business aspects of their field.
Our postgraduates are trained to be able to design systems and collaborate in the creation, development, implementation, and improvement of integrated systems. They develop skills in business management and leadership, and an aptitude for setting up businesses and/or developing new products or services – always from the perspective of efficiency, quality, sustainability, productivity, and competitiveness. Given its scope, the training we provide opens opportunities in numerous areas and sectors of employment: equipment, materials, energy, communications, information technologies, healthcare, finance, transport – every industry, and organizations in general.
Holders of this masters can expertly plan and manage complex and dynamic systems where technological, economic, and organizational factors interact, which makes them a valuable asset to any industry or services company, as well as to any public or private organization that seeks to keep up with the challenges of the present.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Informatics and Multimedia Engineering MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: The Master's course in Informatics and Multimedia Engineering (MEIM) has a general formation in Informatics Engineering that supports the specialization area in Multimedia and Artificial Intelligence, which is consolidated in the Final Master's Work (Dissertation, Project or Curricular Internship).
text:
The Master's course in Informatics and Multimedia Engineering (MEIM) has a general formation in Informatics Engineering that supports the specialization area in Multimedia and Artificial Intelligence, which is consolidated in the Final Master's Work (Dissertation, Project or Curricular Internship).
The MEIM course has a high employability of graduates which are well accepted by employers, both nationally and internationally.
Study programme’s generic objectives
The training of highly skilled technical and scientific Engineering professionals, within multimedia systems and technologies in three main areas of expertise:
Content production
Analysis and organization of content
Distribution of content
The skills in these areas of knowledge are central in the context of multimedia systems, having an increasing impact on our society, such as video surveillance, medical applications, geographic information systems, man-machine interaction through not haptic devices, computer games, robotics);
To provide training where advanced technological and scientific knowledge in the area of multimedia systems and technologies is applied in concrete areas of growing importance in the context of ICT (Information and Communication Technologies);
To provide an innovative training tailored to market requirements, deeply rooted in the relationship with industry.

title: Mechanical Engineering MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Mechanical Engineering is probably the most comprehensive of all engineering areas. Because it deals with the design, production, operation, and maintenance of all kinds of mechanical systems, Mechanical Engineering is present in virtually every sector of activity, from car manufacturing to aeronautics, from industrial equipment to industrial automation and industrial safety, from electrical energy to fossil fuels.
text:
Mechanical Engineering is probably the most comprehensive of all engineering areas. Because it deals with the design, production, operation, and maintenance of all kinds of mechanical systems, Mechanical Engineering is present in virtually every sector of activity, from car manufacturing to aeronautics, from industrial equipment to industrial automation and industrial safety, from electrical energy to fossil fuels. It plays a crucial role in the production, distribution, and energy efficiency of AC systems; in the medical equipment and pharmaceutical industries; in all major developments in composite materials, mechatronics and nanotechnology. Intersecting the biomedical, civil, electric, industrial and chemical engineering areas, Mechanical Engineering is always at the epicenter of human activity.
Our postgraduate students experience a rich and comprehensive program, a practical learning approach grounded on our faculty’s experience in the labour market, and an emphasis on problem-solving skills, communication ability, and autonomy. As a result, holders of our master’s degree can apply their knowledge in solving problems in a vast array of multidisciplinary contexts. Our masters in Mechanical Engineering – in either of its specializations, "Maintenance and Production" or "Energy, Refrigeration and Climatization" – provides its graduates with invaluable training that has long been highly recognized by the labour market.
Whether in industry or services, in production or in research, the knowledge and experience earned in our master’s will meet no hurdles when it comes to employability and ensure high-level performance in a limitless professional area.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Quality and Environmental Engineering MSc | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: ISEL’s master's in Quality and Environmental Engineering provides advanced knowledge in environmental technologies and quality engineering techniques, combined with management methods focused in organizational excellence. Our syllabus focuses on topics of the utmost importance for the planning, control and improvement of processes and products, with an emphasis on efficient use of resources, choice of appropriate technologies and business practices – a complete system where competitiveness and sustainability go hand in hand and complement each other.
text:
ISEL’s master's in Quality and Environmental Engineering provides advanced knowledge in environmental technologies and quality engineering techniques, combined with management methods focused in organizational excellence. Our syllabus focuses on topics of the utmost importance for the planning, control and improvement of processes and products, with an emphasis on efficient use of resources, choice of appropriate technologies and business practices – a complete system where competitiveness and sustainability go hand in hand and complement each other.
In the Quality area of our masters, we address the development of management systems centered on the current tools and techniques of this discipline. From product development to quality control and improvement techniques, we promote our students’ ability to design and use efficient experimental strategies that save time in trials and reduce their costs – crucial factors for any organization in our society. In the Environmental area, and in addition to end-of-line technologies and processes, particular emphasis is given to the concepts, methods and processes of eco-efficiency and rational use of resources, with a view to a sustainable production of goods and services – unavoidable considerations when it comes to the protection of human health, the protection of ecosystems, and the much pressing need to find a balance between the two.
In addition to a rich curriculum featuring topics of recognized relevance and a teaching approach heavily based on lab practice, our master's course is taught by an expert faculty which keeps up to date on all current, pertinent issues by virtue of their extensive research activity. Holders of our master’s degree are thus highly skilled and competent professionals, whose training meets the needs of various sectors and industries: pharmaceutical, chemical, petrochemical, aeronautics, water supply and water requalification entities, environmental control and protection entities, regulatory and certification agencies, and state and private labs.
Contact Us
for more information on the curriculum, faculty and calendar

title: Postgraduate course in Advanced Manufacturing Processes | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
h2: Postgraduate course in Advanced Manufacturing Processes
text:
The Metallurgical and Metalworking industry is a strategic sector, with a high weight in exports, which generates employment and investment. Its strategy focuses on the qualification of human resources, development and innovation, inherent in the use of new materials and new equipment that guarantee high levels of productivity and efficiency, allowing companies to offer products in a competitive and sustainable way.
The postgraduate course in Advanced Manufacturing Processes (AFP) is a multidisciplinary course that addresses several of the new manufacturing technologies and their potential. The aim is to train highly qualified engineering professionals, capable of acting proactively in the design and implementation of differentiated manufacturing solutions and methodologies, which boost the competitiveness of companies.
The curriculum plan ensures the acquisition of practical skills in the field of advanced manufacturing processes, with a focus on the operation and optimization of the performance of CNC equipment.
Classes
The course lasts for 2 semesters, starting in February 2023.
The curricular plan covers curricular units of a theoretical-practical nature and laboratory practice. In all curricular units, the teaching methodology is based on the creation of a dynamic environment, focused on making students active elements in the transfer and construction of knowledge, involving them with the contents covered and stimulating their critical spirit. In particular, in the curricular units of a practical laboratory nature, the process of acquiring skills will be supported by the development of industrial environment simulation activities, based on carrying out practical work involving direct contact with laboratory equipment.
Classes will be held after work hours, weekly, from Wednesday to Friday, between 6:30 pm and 11:00 pm, and on Saturday, between 8:00 am and 2:00 pm

•    Application: 53€
•    Registration: 55€
•    School insurance: 5€

title: Postgraduate course in Building Conservation and Rehabilitation | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Building Conservation and Rehabilitation is currently one of the pillars of the construction sector in Portugal and across Europe. In fact, it is estimated that, by 2030, the weight of this segment in Portugal will have tripled in value and that it will be responsible for about 600,000 jobs. This state of affairs reflects a context of profound change in the sector, and the market lacks qualified professionals in the field of Building Conservation and Rehabilitation technologies.
h2: Postgraduate course in Building Conservation and Rehabilitation
text:
Building Conservation and Rehabilitation is currently one of the pillars of the construction sector in Portugal and across Europe. In fact, it is estimated that, by 2030, the weight of this segment in Portugal will have tripled in value and that it will be responsible for about 600,000 jobs. This state of affairs reflects a context of profound change in the sector, and the market lacks qualified professionals in the field of Building Conservation and Rehabilitation technologies. ISEL’s postgraduate course in Building Conservation and Rehabilitation aims to increment the knowledge and skills of each student, ensuring specialized training in line with what is provided in similar courses by leading colleges and universities in the European space.
Over its two semesters, this postgraduate course provides its students with the most important skills in the various aspects of construction: Pathology, Inspection, Diagnostics, Design, Planning, Intervention and Monitoring are the areas analyzed in greater detail. Our training develops flexible Conservation and Rehabilitation professionals, whose vision is both comprehensive and precise, and who are characterized by their high technical competence and ability to integrate and lead multidisciplinary teams. Our graduates will thus be at the forefront of numerous job and business opportunities.
Classes
Classes will be given after working hours, on Wednesdays and Thursdays from 5:30 pm to 10:30 pm, in person at ISEL's campus.
Fees
Application €53
Registration €55
School insurance €5
Tuition fees
The tuition fee is €2000*. The payment of the tuition fee can be partitioned into two installments: the first, of €1000, paid upon registration; the second, of €1000, to be paid until 23 December 2023.
Numerus clausus
The postgraduate course in Building Conservation and Rehabilitation admits up to 20 students.
Requirements
ISEL’s postgraduate course in Building Conservation and Rehabilitation is aimed at students trained in this field (or related fields) and at professionals who already work, or intend to develop their professional activity, in it, namely:
• Civil Engineers
• Architects
• Other professionals involved or interested in the field of construction, holders of a bachelor’s (or higher) degree
• Individuals whose academic, scientific or professional background/curriculum is recognized as attesting their ability to succeed in this postgraduate course.

title: Postgraduate course in Design and Maintenance of Electrical Installations | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
h2: Postgraduate course in Design and Maintenance of Electrical Installations
text:
As electricity consumption is currently globally responsible for about ¼ of final energy consumption, it is essential to assess how this energy is consumed. In this sense, the design of electrical installations plays an important role in reducing and in the way energy is used, since the efficiency of the installations must always be present in its design. Likewise, the correct operation and maintenance of electrical equipment also contributes to a reduction in consumption and overall improvement in the energy efficiency of the installations.
The PG-PMIE aims to train highly qualified technicians in the area of design and maintenance of electrical installations, helping to meet the needs of companies looking for professionals with this profile. Teaching provides a high technical/practical component, ensured by teaching staff with high qualifications and experience, with a focus on problem solving, preparation of field tests, discussion of ideas and implementation of projects.
Classes
Classes take place between October 2022 and June 2023.
The course is face-to-face, with a duration of 360 contact hours.
Classes take place after working hours, on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays, between 6:30 pm and 10:30 pm.

title: Postgraduate course in Energy Efficiency and Sustainability in Buildings | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
h2: Postgraduate course in Energy Efficiency and Sustainability in Buildings
text:
The energy efficiency and sustainability of buildings are an essential pillar of any country with regard to the urgent need to decarbonize society. Responding to these challenges requires transforming the way in which some of the most decisive aspects of life in society are viewed, in particular with regard to patterns of production, consumption and use of energy and also the way in which cities and housing, work and leisure spaces.
The postgraduate course in Energy Efficiency and Sustainability in Buildings, aimed at engineering and architecture professionals working in the built environment, responds to current concerns in the field of energy efficiency and sustainability, particularly in buildings, and the enormous challenges that arise to this sector, which are determinant in the quality of life of populations and in the development of any country, which result in an urgent need for highly qualified professionals.
Classes
The postgraduate course lasts 30 weeks, with a total of 600 contact hours. Classes will be given after working hours, which may include, from Monday to Friday, from 6:30 pm to 11:00 pm, and/or on Saturdays, from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm, to be defined by July 31, 2022.
Classes will be taught face-to-face, at ISEL's premises, with remote classes being allowed in a room recently equipped with multimedia means suitable for distance learning. Practical classes and exams will preferably be in person.

title: Mathematics for Data Science | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
text:
Regardless of the sector of society, there is no way to ignore the importance of data in today's world. The good performance of any entity, whether public or private, involves defining strategies and making decisions that are heavily dependent on data processing and analysis. This task uses relatively sophisticated statistical and mathematical techniques, but whose specialization is compatible with short-term intensive training. The growing digitization further reinforces the dependence of the labor market on professionals specialized in this area, a dependence that will be felt in the very long term. A bet on this formation is thus a bet on the future.
The postgraduate Mathematics for Data Science (MCD) offers its students an advanced, in-depth and specialized training in Data Science, an area that most curricula do not have the opportunity to develop properly. Equipping students with the necessary statistical and mathematical techniques to develop solid skills in this field and relying on a highly qualified teaching staff, as well as the possibility of crediting the Master in Applied Mathematics for Industry at ISEL, this course is an added value in a area that continues to grow and that verifies a significant shortage of specialized resources.
Classes
Classes take place between September 2022 and June 2023.
The course lasts for 30 weeks, with a total of 405 contact hours.
Classes take place in person, at ISEL's facilities, and after work hours, from Monday to Friday, between 6:00 pm and 11:00 pm.

School insurance €5
Tuition Fees
The amount of the MCD fee is €1050. Payment is made in two installments, the first in the amount of €525, paid upon registration, the second in the amount of €525, paid by 12/23/2022.
Vacancies

title: Postgraduate in Engineering and Disaster Risk Management | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
h2: Postgraduate in Engineering and Disaster Risk Management
text:
The occurrence of natural and technological disasters, the emergence of pandemics and the use of chemical products in industry and agriculture have brutal impacts on the lives of entire communities and require immediate and effective responses from the competent authorities. This response requires the existence of multifaceted professionals with effective skills and tools in the management of crises and disasters.
The Disaster Risk Engineering and Management postgraduate course is an innovative course in the Portuguese context and covers all stages of disaster risk management, with a special focus on the engineering and technology perspectives. Its main objective is to train highly qualified professionals, equipped with specific knowledge and tools for crisis and disaster management. It is aimed at professionals working in the areas of civil and environmental engineering, geology, architecture, public administration and city management and will allow its graduates to acquire skills that enable them to develop efficient prevention, mitigation, assessment and response strategies in emergency situations.
The course was developed in accordance with the guidelines of the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction, endorsed by the UN.
Classes
Theoretical and theoretical-practical classes will take place after working hours, on Fridays (from 6:00 pm to 10:00 pm) and Saturdays (in general, from 9:00 am to 1:00 pm), preferably in person at ISEL's campus.
Field trips will consist of accompanied visits to institutions operating in areas of activity relevant to the course.
Fees
Application €53
Registration €55
School insurance €5
Tuition fees
The tuition fee is €2700. Payment can be partitioned into three installments, each of which of €900. The first should be paid upon registration; the second until 15 july 2024; and the third until 15 december 2024.
Within the scope of the Adults Impulse Program of the Recovery and Resilience Plan, this Postgraduate Program grants scholarships for students based on merit and as an incentive to female students.
Numerus clausus
The Disaster Risk Engineering and Management postgraduate course admits up to 25 students.

title: Postgraduate course in Renewable Energy Engineering and Management | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Current global concerns in the field of sustainability, most particularly in the energy sector, and the enormous challenges facing this sector, result in a pressing need for highly qualified professionals.
h2: Postgraduate course in Renewable Energy Engineering and Management
text:
Current global concerns in the field of sustainability, most particularly in the energy sector, and the enormous challenges facing this sector, result in a pressing need for highly qualified professionals.
ISEL’s postgraduate course in Renewable Energy Engineering and Management (EGER) is aimed at those who work in companies operating in the field of renewable energy, as well as at students who have recently completed their bachelor or master degrees and wish to work in this sector. With a comprehensive curriculum and a highly qualified faculty, EGER is a unique opportunity to receive advanced training in the field of renewable energy and developing skills in the technological fields of renewable energy, and energy and environment management and economics.
The teaching component of this postgraduate course takes place between September and July, followed by a two-month internship or final project. EGER counts with the collaboration of relevant actors in this field, such as EDP Renewables, REN - National Electrical Network, and LNEG - The National Laboratory of Energy and Geology. They co-organize complementary seminars, arrange for specialists affiliated with them to lecture in our course, and make their facilities available for technical visits.
Classes
Classes take place between September 2023 and June 2024, followed by an internship or final project lasting 2 months.
The course is face-to-face, lasting 534 contact hours, of which 404 hours are of theoretical-practical teaching component and 130 hours of internship or final project in order to allow the training of skills acquired throughout the training process.
Classes take place at night, on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays, between 6:30 pm and 10:30 pm.
On a monthly basis, there will be complementary seminars with speakers with relevant professional experience in the area of ​​renewable energy from EGER partner companies and institutions.
Fees
Application €53
Registration €55
School insurance €5
Tuition fees
The tuition fee is €2400 and includes attendance at all modules of the curriculum, the final project or internship, seminars and technical visits. Payment can be made in three installments of €800 each. The first installment is due at the time of registration, in September 2023, the second installment is due by January 31, 2024, and the third installment is due by April 30, 2024.
There are special conditions for participants from EGER partner institutions who register two or more employees and for students continuing their studies (who have completed or will complete the degree that qualifies them to apply to EGER in 2023 or 2024). Participants under these conditions benefit from a 20% reduction in the annual fee.
Numerus clausus
The postgraduate course in Renewable Energy Engineering and Management admits up to 20 students.
Requirements
ISEL’s postgraduate course in Renewable Energy Engineering and Management is aimed at students trained in this field (or related fields) and at professionals who already work, or intend to develop their professional activity in it, namely:
• Holders of a bachelor’s (or equivalent) degree in Engineering, Economics, Management, Mathematics, Physics or related field;
• Individuals whose academic, scientific or professional background/curriculum is recognized as attesting their ability to succeed in this post-graduate course.

title: Postgraduate Specialization in Railway Engineering | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: Parternership:

Parternership:
The Postgraduate Specialization in Railway Engineering is characterized by a strong practical component, ensured by technicians with high qualifications and accumulated experience in the field.
This course intends to address to the country's need for qualified technicians in the railway area, through the training of flexible professionals, with a global and detailed vision in the area of Railway Engineering, in its various aspects, allowing the acquisition of high technical skills as well as integration and leadership in multidisciplinary teams.

title: Civil Engineering | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: The Department of Civil Engineering is dedicated to the development and transmission of knowledge. It delivers state-of-the-art knowledge in Civil Engineering and related areas, enabling its students to meet the needs and challenges of a society in clear scientific-technological development.
text:
The Department of Civil Engineering is dedicated to the development and transmission of knowledge. It delivers state-of-the-art knowledge in Civil Engineering and related areas, enabling its students to meet the needs and challenges of a society in clear scientific-technological development.
The department offers bachelors and masters’ courses and is equipped with all the technical and scientific resources to ensure high-quality teaching and R&D. Its faculty is composed of researchers linked to the national labs for technological development, and public and private sector senior managers affiliated with industry and services, which ensures the necessary connection to a specialized business sector, mainly in the areas of Building, Structures, Hydraulics, and Roads and Transportation.
As a result of bringing together academic and professional skills, the Department of Civil Engineering has been training thousands of civil engineers who promote the implementation and technological development of a myriad of infrastructures necessary for the progress of our society.

Civil Engineering BSc
Municipal Technologies and Management  BSc
Civil Engineering MSc

title: Electronics, Telecommunications and Computer Engineering | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: The Department of Electronics, Telecommunications and Computer Engineering (DEETC) creates and imparts state-of-the-art knowledge in the field of Electronics, Telecommunications and Computer Engineering – knowledge that is essential in the development of an increasingly digital society.
text:
The Department of Electronics, Telecommunications and Computer Engineering (DEETC) creates and imparts state-of-the-art knowledge in the field of Electronics, Telecommunications and Computer Engineering – knowledge that is essential in the development of an increasingly digital society.
The DEETC teaches three courses leading to engineering degrees: two bachelors and one master. These courses reflect the innovation and pedagogical skill achieved through our lecturers’ involvement in postgraduate training, or through their participation in projects developed in collaboration with companies, as well as with public, private, national, and international entities. The DEETC’s faculty is composed of senior managers from industry and services organizations, operating in the public and private sectors. The department has its own labs, equipped with technical and scientific resources that meet both teaching and R&D needs in the subjects covered in our syllabus: software development, information systems, electronic systems, communication networks, signal processing, multimedia, and telecommunications systems.
The excellence of the thousands of professionals trained at the DEETC is well known and highly regarded in the business and scientific communities. Our graduates have an employability rate of around 100% and can be found in senior positions in national and multinational companies.
Courses
Electronics, Telecommunications and Computer Engineering  BSc
Informatics, Networks and Telecommunications Engineering BSc
Electronics and Telecommunications Engineering MSc
Postgraduate course in New Approaches in Applied Acoustics and Audio
Postgraduate course in Optoelectronics and Photonics Engineering

title: Electrical, Energy and Automation Engineering | Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Lisboa
meta_description: The Department of Electrical, Energy and Automation Engineering (DEEEA) promotes the transmission of knowledge in Electric Engineering and related fields, and it is constantly searching for innovation and development in emerging areas at a global level, namely the development of alternative sources of energy and industrial automation.
text:
The Department of Electrical, Energy and Automation Engineering (DEEEA) promotes the transmission of knowledge in Electric Engineering and related fields, and it is constantly searching for innovation and development in emerging areas at a global level, namely the development of alternative sources of energy and industrial automation.
The DEEEA carries out teaching activities leading to bachelor’s and master’s degrees, supports postgraduate training and research, and provides services to the community. The department’s faculty combines academic knowledge with professional experience and its labs ensure the effectiveness of the practical component of our teaching. Our goal is the excellence of our students, who are to be a reference in the national business context. The knowledge imparted to our graduates is essential in solving the varied challenges related to the technological and sustainable development of our society.
The DEEEA's responsibility, professionalism and dedication are rewarded with the level of excellence achieved by its graduates, whose employability rate is around 100%.
